data.title: Liza Minnelli vows to stay silent over ex husband David Gest's death after controversial marriage
data.meta_description: The 62-year-old star was found dead at the Four Seasons Hotel in London's Canary Wharf on Tuesday
data.text:
David Gest's ex-wife Liza Minnelli is refusing to comment on David Gest's death after their controversial whirlwind marriage.

The 62-year-old star was found dead at the Four Seasons Hotel in London's Canary Wharf on Tuesday after battling a number of illnesses and didn't speak to his ex after their divorce ended up being the dirtiest in Hollywood.

Her rep has confirmed to Mirror Online she will not be commenting when approached for a statement.

David Gest "never wanted to be famous" when he married singer Liza in 2002, but ended up frequently making tabloid headlines. They split 16 months later after explosive rows before finally divorcing in 2007.

She was at her lowest ebb when they tied the knot, tipping the scales at 17 stone following five trips to rehab, but her troubles continued after their $3.5million wedding.

Their split was played out in public with allegations of drunken rages and assault, after which David sued the star for $10 million in damages for spousal abuse.

Read more:

Gest also accused her of not telling him she was carrying the herpes disease before he signed a pre-nuptial agreement, with his lawyers claiming she perpetrated a fraud.

According to documents filed by Gest's lawyer in 2006: "A person who knows he or she has an infectious disease and has sexual relations with another is guilty of a misdemeanour."

He also accused her of attacking him on a number of occasions, including an incident in 2003 while they were staying at London's Connaught Hotel.

Legal papers claimed Liza "began beating [Gest] about the head and face with her fists without relenting...Alcohol gave her remarkable force and strength."

In an interview the BBC, he said: "There's a part of me that never wanted to be quote 'a celebrity' when I was married - I can't remember the woman's name."

When prompted by the interviewer that the wife was Liza, he quipped: "I knew it was Elizabeth. I never wanted to be in the public eye.

"It's very hard when you wake up each day and there's press outside your house. I would never want to live that type of life, I live a very simple life."

They continue to slam each other in the press, with Liza telling US talk show host Joy Behar she was unaware she paid for their wedding until recently.

A total of 300 guests attended the ceremony at New York's St Regis hotel. Michael Jackson was best man with Elizabeth Taylor was matron-of-honour.

Other stars in attendance included Joan Collins, Mia Farrow, Elton John and Donald Trump.
